dc_description_s: The Public Art Building Communities grant (PABC) is available to individual artists and organizations to create and install temporary or permanent public artwork that enhances District neighborhoods. Eligible projects include Performance art based projects are ineligible for PABC funding.The DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities recognizes the importance of remaining relevant in a city of competitive opportunities for residents who have at their disposal significant discretionary income for arts and cultural offerings.   Further1 billion in economic activity is generated annually by the non-profit arts and culture industry in Washington  Additionally  These trends create an opportunity for DCCAH to position itself at the forefront of the city’s cultural planning.   To achieve this goal
dct_spatial_sm: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
dc_title_s: Public Art Building Communities: Washington, D.C., 2013
